I200312160010 + export from 1158.
I just found this in the log but could not reproduce.

The caret was in the method name of a declaration ...
    private boolean accessesAnnonymousFields() {
... and I hovered over the left ruler. After the NPE was logged, the hover over
the left ruler didn't appear any more. It only came back after closing and
repoening the editor.

I have "Mark occurrences in file" and "Enable light bulb for quick assist"
switched on and the method was new and marked by QuickDiff in a block of added
lines.

Can reproduce in I20031216-0800:

A.java:
public class A {
	int accessesAnnonymousFields() {
	    return 17;
	}
}

- Have "Mark occurrences in file" and "Enable light bulb for quick assist" on.
(QuickDiff is not contributing to this bug.)
- Open the file A.java
- wait until UI completely updated
- set caret to after "A"
- wait until UI completely updated
- doubleclick on "accessesAnnonymousFields"
- wait until UI completely updated
- hover over the two icons in the left ruler
-> Bang!
Verified in I20031218010 that the code contains the fix.
